title: Yorick right now it just a pretty sad thing to see
body:
http://i63.tinypic.com/2l9760k.png

The bottom of top laners along {{champion:516}} with the exception that Ornn saw alot of world players while Yorick saw none.

And if we back to the reason why they nerfed {{champion:83}} cause he can stomp top lane in split pushing on himself yet they legit just leaving both of {{champion:23}} and {{champion:24}} without any nerf.

Plus on the top of that back then they nerfed {{champion:86}} Q damage which made no difference aside from little nerf in late game while still he doing much better in long run than Yorick cause he didn't get his core damn kit nerfed like Yorick did.

replies.body: HIs data spiked super low this patch because there was a ghoul bug which hit him to the tune of around 5-8%. The fix was micropatched out yesterday so he should be returning to his former ~52% shortly

Hey, man.  
I would appreciate if we could discuss something.  I have been trying to provide certain feedback since the Yorick rework and have had several moderately popular threads regarding my feedback, but I have never been able to get a Rioter to engage with me about it. 

I used to be a dedicated Yorick main before his rework, and he even still remains my highest mastery champion even though I dropped him after his rework.  I think his rework was well made, but it had the side effect of alienating me from the champion.  The issue for me isn't that he changed too much overall in the rework or that he's too weak overall.  I think reworked Yorick is/was objectively stronger, but he has lost essentially all of his role flexibility, which I doubt was an intention of the rework.  

I personally played him mainly as a support and secondarily as a jungler prior to the rework.  I think he could be tweaked relatively easily to regain some of his role flexibility and even have improved strategic decision-making as a top-laner without increasing his net power in top lane.  Yorick has a very small playerbase and is at risk of falling to his pre-rework popularity rate if he is continually neglected.  The statistics seem to show that his play rate tends to only rise in relation to his power budget, suggesting that he isn't sufficiently fulfilling to play for many people or he lacks wide appeal for other reasons.  

By improving his off-role viability, you can broaden his appeal, allowing him to be appropriately balanced around 49-52% winrate without his popularity dwindling to <1%.  I think that with minimal tweaks, you could keep his top-lane play rate near its current 0.7-1% while aiming to attract an additional 0.3% jungle Yorick playerbase and 0.2% support Yorick playerbase, giving him a healthy and completely reasonable total presence of 1.2-1.5% pick rate.  If this were successful, it would even likely be possible to slightly tune down his power in top lane (let's say 49-51% win rate) without his top lane playerbase declining since having role flexibility makes a champion more desirable to main in total and more total Yorick mains translates into a more stable top lane presence without requiring overtuning.

I can offer insight into what made his support and jungle off-roles attractive before the rework and what specifically changed that makes them feel less playable.  I have specific ideas on how he can be tweaked.  We can chat on the boards or privately somewhere else such as in the game client.  We can keep our discussion between us in case you are concerned about something being taken as committal that Riot will actually implement any changes.

I certainly didn't know you could play him in the jungle or support pre-rework.....and being an ADC main that was once a top main and had to fight against pre-rework Yorick several times......I dread to think of how that lane would have played out.

But as of now, I can certainly see some appeal for pulling him those other roles. However...

In the jungle, if they do give him tools to survive it, he may become as oppressive as like season 4-5 Elise, where he can stay so healthy in the jungle, that any time he invades, he would be unmatched. It would also make his ganks super easy, and without much risk involved, which is essential to having a balanced jungler. So, I doubt we'll see him in the jungle due to how much of a potential problem he could be.

As for support.....I don't see why you can't play him support right now. If you're pretty good at landing his W and E, you could likely play him like a tanky Zyra. Not to mention, since he is melee, his Q should work quite well with Relic Shield. Also, due to how his ult works, you can send it down a lane to help out another laner, or just slow push a lane that doesn't have anyone in it, and go back to being a front line for your team. He has enough utility in his kit that, honestly, I could see him as a support right now. He'd likely be really weak to poke supports, like Brand or Zyra, but against the current hard engage, tanky supports we're constantly seeing right now, he'd pair up against them quite nicely.

Just my 2 cents.

He was a strong enough jungler that some pro players used him in the jungle. Here is a game with C9 Meteos playing in the jungle:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=PJghqBuQfkM

His support was much rarer and more off-meta but it still worked surprisingly well.  Compared to the pre-rework Yorick, his supportive options are extremely lacking.  The rework has introduced all of these cons:

* He no longer has on-demand ghouls (w) to reactively block skill shots.  This was a big part of the learning curve of support Yorick.  It made a good support Yorick a strong counter to Blitzcrank, Thresh, and Morgana by blocking their hooks/bindings.

* His ranged harass potential is much weaker.
 
* His ultimate does not offer anywhere near equivalent supportive utility to the pre-rework version.  Before the rework, it worked as a pseudo-Zilean-ult that also amplified a carry's strength because the revenant scaled with whoever it was cast on.  This ability was a perfect fit on a support and had a lot of different ways in which it could be used.

* His sustain in bot lane is much less reliable and weaker unless if he constantly pushes the lane by frequently casting Q on minions.  Even disregarding the negative repercussions of being forced to push his lane, it is often too risky for Yorick to expose himself by going into melee range of minions in a duo lane and this is usually all the more true against the kinds of poke lanes where he really needs sustain options.  His Q is balanced around being a spammable last-hitting tool designed with only top lane in mind.  Previously, he could cast his E on an enemy champion to poke and sustain without disrupting the wave flow.  He went from being quite good vs poke lanes to being bad against poke.

* He can hardly use his ghouls at all as a support because they've been pretty strictly gated behind last-hitting and relic shield alone doesn't allow him to last-hit often enough for his kit to function well in laning.  Also his ghouls don't often offer a great deal of value in bot lane since they will often just disrupt your carry's ability to control the waves which will tilt them.

* He can no longer brush check with his (w) ghouls and provide continuous vision on targets with his ghouls.

* He can no longer clear traps with his (w) ghouls on-demand.


While the only really benefit to Yorick's supporting that I see coming from the rework is:

* His W is more useful against certain matchups, mainly for caging Leona when she dives in.  It also tends to be slightly better than his old W for peeling ganks and punishing tower dives, but it really depends on whether the enemy has the ability to dash out of the cage or has mobility to evade it before it closes.
I used to main him in the Jungle, you barely took damage because of the ghoul spam + blue buff

Jungle Yorick is pretty viable.  He's my main and that's the only role I play him in.  He has the damage and the sustain to clear quickly and without pots, and has unique cc that really punishes immobile champs.  His only issue is his setup.  Without ghouls his clear speed is way slower, and he can't just walk through lanes without paying attention to where the minion wave is.  Plus if he misses E his gank is almost guaranteed to fail.  He doesn't need any more tools for jungle at least (besides some bugfixing), my issue is that his power is concentrated in his tower damage, so everything else has to be unreliable.

They feel pretty useless for the amount of setup they require.
And considerating that his only other damaging ability is his Q/ his ult having one if the highest  CDs in the game you would think the ghouls should be rather strong.

> [{quoted}](name=Riot MapleNectar,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=qxAOq2m8,comment-id=0005,timestamp=2018-10-26T17:07:53.800+0000)

Ohh no one did hear about that bug, we getting a feedback on that in the patch notes soon ?

Meddler actually posted about it in his Gameplay Updates, i don't think it'll hit patch notes but for context for those that don't know what the bug was.

Yoricks Gouls spawned from his ultimate were spawning with level 1 stats unstead of scaling to Yoricks level, meaning that only his ghouls that spawned from minions or monster kills were doing damage mid-late game and if you used your ultimate all your ghouls would be reverted basically to level 1.
Come on dude, don't just ignore Hemulen Magi like this. Even telling him you can't say anything is better than nothing.

> [{quoted}](name=Riot MapleNectar,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=qxAOq2m8,comment-id=0005,timestamp=2018-10-26T17:07:53.800+0000)

I don't care about data spikes or any of that, just hijacking this to say seriously, when the hell are you all reworking Tyrndamere. I don't need to talk about winrate or any of that, I just had a Tryndamere go from losing lane after being camped, to diving me under tower repeatedly because he does so much auto damage and is next to impossible to run away from AND can go invincible for 5 seconds if he needs to (which he usually doesn't). The man was diving nexus turrets at 24 mins WITHOUT ULT. This champ is just unbalanced, there is little effective counterplay for most champs short of running away as he takes your towers. I swear when is he getting a rework, this is some season one levels of unbalanced, which btw he hasn't really changed all that much since then, other than some stat changes and cds.

Cause passive and his R are his core, his Q damage just like yorick Q damage just an AA reset that give extra damage + effect.

His passive is overrated as hell. Don't get me wrong, I love it and would hate to see it go, but it really isn't that big of a deal.

His R is an execute, he's not gonna kill you with just his R.

You go q e r to kill someone. Your q is a slow cleanse, Ms boost, damage steroid and a silence. There's no way in hell his passive is more impactfully than his q.

> [{quoted}](name=Jerry SeinfeId,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=qxAOq2m8,comment-id=00030000000000000000,timestamp=2018-10-26T17:34:05.876+0000)

You kinda forgot that his R give him passive as well that make him put true damage on his villain target.

that changes absolutely nothing. 

His R is by all means his most powerfull ability, but his Q is used in almost everything he does, even just running at someone to r would most likely involve his Q.

Q is his bread and butter skill, his main burst and trade tool, his escape and slow cleanse, his only way in or out, his only CC, the start to his combos, his trigger for Grasps, he uses it to proc tri/sheen, its his only auto attack reset, its crucial for CSing (especially under tower and at low level) work on towers to help his pushing, etc

Its literally his most important skill, and he relies on it more than literally any other skill.

Wukong Q give him armor pen and range, Yorick Q give him damage and graves , Daruis W give him the slow and Nasus Q give him the stacks.
When i talk about a core kit i talk about the effectiveness of the kit it self as in ghouls for yorick, garen true damage and healing ,illaoi tentacles i talking about the effect more than damage.

So when they nerfed garen they nerf his Q damage not it effect not it CDR while on other hand they hit yorick the core it self.

Tell me something what made wukong goes down to ground all of sudden ? cause the q damage nerf ? Nah cause the whole kit got nerfed because of items and runes which was the main reason he was very strong in this meta before the hard nerf to assassin builds.

Due to the fact garen doesnt really have a trading combo... its just silence>spin , and run away while using W so you dont take dmg in return. Plus garen's Q counts as an auto , and if you add grasp, it hurts a lot. The champion is simple and has simple abilities , SO EVERY ABILITY IS PART OF HIS CORE KIT (maybe not W tho lul).

The reason that Orrn has a very low WR in SQ but sees a ton of worlds play is because Orrn is a safe tank that brings guaranteed engage, while the picks that beat him are generally riskier picks.  So What makes him great in high level team play means nothing in SQ where the enemy player counter-picks you and even if you go even in lane, your team doesn't follow up on your engages.
